alert.note: Alert for Dooly; Macon; Sumter (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 4:03AM EDT until March 31 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Dooly, Sumter and Macon Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Dodge and Telfair Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Johnson, Laurens and Wilkinson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Johnson and Wilkinson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands and extensive flood plain along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 26. The access road to Georges Boat Landing is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EDT Friday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
